titleStmt.title: Bridge Phase 2: Witness fMS, Collation unit C20

body.ab: <lb n="c57-0031__main__1"/><milestone spanTo="#c57-0031.11" unit="tei:head"/>another Chapter<lb n="c57-0031__main__2"/>Sometime elapsed before I <del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4228__Start"/>became informed<del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4228__End"/><lb n="c57-0031__main__3"/><lb n="c57-0031__left_margin__1"/><del loc="c57-0031__left_margin__d1e4237__Start"/> of th <del loc="c57-0031__left_margin__d1e4237__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>learned the history of my friends. It was one <del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4250__Start"/>that<del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4250__End"/><lb n="c57-0031__main__4"/><lb n="c57-0031__left_margin__1"/> which could not fail to impress itself deeply on my <lb n="c57-0031__main__5"/>mind unfolding as it did a number of <lb n="c57-0031__main__6"/>circumstances each inter<del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4273__Start"/>r<del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4273__End"/>esting &wonder<lb n="c57-0031__main__7"/>ful to one so utterly inexperienced as I <lb n="c57-0031__main__8"/>was. <del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4285__Start"/>2<del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4285__End"/><milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0031__main__9"/>The name of the old man was De Lacey. <lb n="c57-0031__main__10"/>He was decended from a good family in France &<lb n="c57-0031__main__11"/>untill very lately had lived where for many years <lb n="c57-0031__main__12"/>he had lived in affluence respected by his superiors <lb n="c57-0031__main__13"/>& beloved by his equals. His two children Felix &Aga<lb n="c57-0031__main__14"/>tha His son was bred in the service of his country <lb n="c57-0031__main__15"/>& Agatha had <del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4326__Start"/>been<del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4326__End"/>ranked<del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4332__Start"/>woed<del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4332__End"/><del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4335__Start"/>by gentlemen<del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4335__End"/>with ladies of the <lb n="c57-0031__main__16"/>highest distinction. A few months <del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4344__Start"/>previous<del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4344__End"/>before<lb n="c57-0031__main__17"/><del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4351__Start"/>to<del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4351__End"/> my arrival they had lived in a large &lux<lb n="c57-0031__main__18"/>urious city called Paris, surrounded by friends <lb n="c57-0031__main__19"/>& possessed of every enjoyment that <del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4366__Start"/>that<del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4366__End"/>which virtue <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>& refinement of intellect & taste,ac<lb n="c57-0031__main__20"/>companied with a competent fortune could <lb n="c57-0031__main__21"/>afford.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0031__main__22"/>The father of Safie <del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4399__Start"/>was<del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4399__End"/>had been the cause of their <lb n="c57-0031__main__23"/><del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4409__Start"/>fall<del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4409__End"/>ruin; He was a Turkish Merchant and had <lb n="c57-0031__main__24"/><del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4423__Start"/>li<del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4423__End"/> inhabited Paris for many years. When his person <lb n="c57-0031__main__25"/>became <del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4431__Start"/>for some<del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4431__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>for some reason which I could not learn obnoxious to the govern<lb n="c57-0031__main__26"/>mentâ€“ He was seized and cast into prison <lb n="c57-0031__main__27"/>the very day that Safie arrived from Constan<lb n="c57-0031__main__28"/>tinople to join him. He was tried & condemned <lb n="c57-0031__main__29"/>to death. The injustice of his sentence was very <lb n="c57-0031__main__30"/>flagrant All Paris were indignant & it <lb n="c57-0031__main__31"/>was judged that his relig<del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4463__Start"/>i<del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4463__End"/>ion and wealth <lb n="c57-0031__main__32"/><del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4468__Start"/>had been the causes of his condemnation rather<del loc="c57-0031__main__d1e4468__End"/><lb n="c57-0032__main__1"/><lb n="c57-0032__left_margin__1"/><del loc="c57-0032__left_margin__d1e4482__Start"/>than<del loc="c57-0032__left_margin__d1e4482__End"/>rather than the crime alledged against him <lb n="c57-0032__main__2"/><lb n="c57-0032__left_margin__1"/>had been the <lb n="c57-0032__left_margin__2"/>cause of his <lb n="c57-0032__left_margin__3"/>condemnation Felix was present at his trial; <del loc="c57-0032__main__d1e4505__Start"/>&<del loc="c57-0032__main__d1e4505__End"/> his horror & in <lb n="c57-0032__main__3"/>dignation <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>were uncontrolable when he heard the <lb n="c57-0032__main__4"/><del loc="c57-0032__main__d1e4532__Start"/>event.<del loc="c57-0032__main__d1e4532__End"/> decision of the court. He made at that moment a solemn <lb n="c57-0032__main__5"/>vow to deliver him & then looked around <lb n="c57-0032__main__6"/>for the means. After many fruitless <lb n="c57-0032__main__7"/>attempts to gain admittance to the pri<lb n="c57-0032__main__8"/>son<del loc="c57-0032__main__d1e4556__Start"/>goal<del loc="c57-0032__main__d1e4556__End"/>prison he found a st<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>rongly grated window <lb n="c57-0032__main__9"/>in an unguarded part of the <del loc="c57-0032__main__d1e4578__Start"/>prison<del loc="c57-0032__main__d1e4578__End"/>building,<lb n="c57-0032__main__10"/>which <del loc="c57-0032__main__d1e4587__Start"/>li<del loc="c57-0032__main__d1e4587__End"/><del loc="c57-0032__main__d1e4590__Start"/>illuminated<del loc="c57-0032__main__d1e4590__End"/> lighted the dungeon <lb n="c57-0032__main__11"/>of the unfortunate Mahometan, who <lb n="c57-0032__main__12"/>loaded with chains waited in despair <lb n="c57-0032__main__13"/>the execution of the barbarous sen<lb n="c57-0032__main__14"/>tence. Felix visited the grate at night <lb n="c57-0032__main__15"/><del loc="c57-0032__main__d1e4608__Start"/>h<del loc="c57-0032__main__d1e4608__End"/> and made known to the prisoner his <lb n="c57-0032__main__16"/>intentions in his favour. The Turk <lb n="c57-0032__main__17"/>amazed and delighted endeavoured to <del loc="c57-0032__main__d1e4620__Start"/>warm<del loc="c57-0032__main__d1e4620__End"/><lb n="c57-0032__left_margin__1"/>kindle<lb n="c57-0032__main__18"/>the zeal of his <del loc="c57-0032__main__d1e4634__Start"/>promised<del loc="c57-0032__main__d1e4634__End"/> deliverer by <lb n="c57-0032__main__19"/>promises of reward & wealth. Felix rejected <lb n="c57-0032__main__20"/>his offers with contempt Yet when he <lb n="c57-0032__main__21"/>saw the lovely Safie who was allowed <lb n="c57-0032__main__22"/>to visit her father & who by her <del loc="c57-0032__main__d1e4646__Start"/>expressive<del loc="c57-0032__main__d1e4646__End"/><lb n="c57-0032__main__23"/>gestures expressed her lively gratitude, the <lb n="c57-0032__main__24"/>youth could not help owning to his own <lb n="c57-0032__main__25"/>mind that the captive possessed a <lb n="c57-0032__main__26"/>treasure which <metamark function="insert">^</metamark><del loc="c57-0032__main__d1e4663__Start"/>altho it had not en<del loc="c57-0032__main__d1e4663__End"/> would fully reward his <lb n="c57-0032__main__27"/>toil & hazard.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0032__main__28"/>The Turk quickly perceived the im<lb n="c57-0032__main__29"/>pression that his daughter had made on<lb n="c57-0033__main__1"/>heart of Felix <del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4688__Start"/>and resolved to obtain<del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4688__End"/>his <lb n="c57-0033__main__2"/>at any price the full zeal and <del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4700__Start"/>resolved<del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4700__End"/><lb n="c57-0033__left_margin__1"/>endeavored <lb n="c57-0033__main__3"/>to secure <del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4719__Start"/>the<del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4719__End"/><del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4722__Start"/>interrest<del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4722__End"/> him <del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4727__Start"/>at any pr<del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4727__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>more entirely by <lb n="c57-0033__main__4"/>the promise of her hand in marriage; <lb n="c57-0033__main__5"/>Felix was too delicate to accept <del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4745__Start"/>offer<del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4745__End"/><del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4750__Start"/>this<del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4750__End"/>offer yet <lb n="c57-0033__main__6"/>he looked forward to the probability of <lb n="c57-0033__main__7"/>that event as the consummation of <lb n="c57-0033__main__8"/>his happiness.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0033__main__9"/>The Turk informed Safie of his <lb n="c57-0033__main__10"/>intentions and <lb n="c57-0033__main__11"/><metamark function="separate">_________________________</metamark><lb n="c57-0033__main__12"/>and rank <del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4778__Start"/>her father<del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4778__End"/>the merchant commander <lb n="c57-0033__main__13"/><del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4789__Start"/>her<del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4789__End"/>his daughter to think no more of <del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4798__Start"/>him<del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4798__End"/>her lover but to <lb n="c57-0033__main__14"/>repare to return to her native country <lb n="c57-0033__main__15"/>with him.â€“The generous nature of Safie <lb n="c57-0033__main__16"/>was outraged by this command â€“She attempt<lb n="c57-0033__main__17"/>ed to expostulate with her father but <lb n="c57-0033__main__18"/>he left<del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4820__Start"/>er<del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4820__End"/> her angrily <del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4823__Start"/>re<del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4823__End"/> reiterating his <lb n="c57-0033__main__19"/>tyrannical command.<del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4832__Start"/>orders.<del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4832__End"/><milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0033__main__20"/>A few days after the Turk entered <lb n="c57-0033__main__21"/>his daughters appartment and told her <lb n="c57-0033__main__22"/>hastily that he had reason to believe <lb n="c57-0033__main__23"/>that his residence in Leghorn had been <lb n="c57-0033__main__24"/>divulged and that he <del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4849__Start"/>would<del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4849__End"/><del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4853__Start"/>was<del loc="c57-0033__main__d1e4853__End"/> should speedily <lb n="c57-0033__main__25"/>be delivered <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>up to the French Governmentâ€“ <lb n="c57-0033__main__26"/>He had just heard of a small vessel <lb n="c57-0033__main__27"/>bound for Constantinople which He had <lb n="c57-0033__main__28"/>consequently hired a vessel to convey him<lb n="c57-0034__main__1"/>to <del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e4887__Start"/>Can<del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e4887__End"/> Constantinople for which city he should <lb n="c57-0034__main__2"/>sail in few hours. He intended to leave his <lb n="c57-0034__main__3"/>daughter <del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e4904__Start"/>to foll<del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e4904__End"/> under the care of a servant <lb n="c57-0034__main__4"/>to follow at her leisure with the greater part <lb n="c57-0034__main__5"/>of his property which had not yet arrived <lb n="c57-0034__main__6"/>at Leghorn.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0034__main__7"/><del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e4917__Start"/>Lef<del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e4917__End"/><del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e4920__Start"/>Deserted by her father<del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e4920__End"/> Safie revolved <lb n="c57-0034__main__8"/>in her own mind the <del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e4925__Start"/>various<del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e4925__End"/> plan<del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e4928__Start"/>s<del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e4928__End"/> of con<lb n="c57-0034__main__9"/>duct that it would become her to pursue <lb n="c57-0034__main__10"/>in this emergency.<del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e4942__Start"/>The slavery<del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e4942__End"/> A residence in Turkey was ab<lb n="c57-0034__main__11"/>horrent to her â€“ her religion & feelings were <lb n="c57-0034__main__12"/>alike adverse to it. By some papers <del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e4954__Start"/>that<del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e4954__End"/><lb n="c57-0034__main__13"/>of her fathers that fell into her hands she <lb n="c57-0034__main__14"/>heard of the exile of her lover and <del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e4962__Start"/>the<del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e4962__End"/><lb n="c57-0034__main__15"/>learnt the name of the spot where <lb n="c57-0034__main__16"/>he resided. She hesitated some time but at <lb n="c57-0034__main__17"/>length she formed her resolution â€”Taking <lb n="c57-0034__main__18"/>with her some jewels that belonged to her, <lb n="c57-0034__main__19"/>and a small sum of money; she quitted <lb n="c57-0034__main__20"/>Italy with an<del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e4981__Start"/>servant who<del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e4981__End"/> attendant a <lb n="c57-0034__main__21"/>native of Leghorn but who understood Tur <lb n="c57-0034__main__22"/>kishArabic and departed for Germany. She arrived <lb n="c57-0034__main__23"/><del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e4997__Start"/>safely<del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e4997__End"/> in safety at a town about 20 leagues <lb n="c57-0034__main__24"/>from the Cottage of De Lacey â€“ her attendant <lb n="c57-0034__main__25"/>then fell <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>dangerously ill <del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e5021__Start"/>and she was retarded wh<del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e5021__End"/> Safie <lb n="c57-0034__main__26"/><del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e5025__Start"/>watched<del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e5025__End"/> nursed her with the most devoted <lb n="c57-0034__main__27"/>affection but the poor girl died &<del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e5033__Start"/>Safie<del loc="c57-0034__main__d1e5033__End"/>the Arabian<lb n="c57-0034__main__28"/>was left alone unacquainted with the lan<lb n="c57-0035__main__1"/>guage of the country and utterly ignorant of <lb n="c57-0035__main__2"/>the customs of the world.â€“ She fell <del loc="c57-0035__main__d1e5055__Start"/>hover<del loc="c57-0035__main__d1e5055__End"/> however <lb n="c57-0035__main__3"/>in to good handsâ€“ The hostess of the Inn was in<lb n="c57-0035__main__4"/>terrested in her fate<del loc="c57-0035__main__d1e5071__Start"/>And<del loc="c57-0035__main__d1e5071__End"/><del loc="c57-0035__main__d1e5075__Start"/>and<del loc="c57-0035__main__d1e5075__End"/> The Italian <lb n="c57-0035__main__5"/><del loc="c57-0035__main__d1e5081__Start"/>before her death<del loc="c57-0035__main__d1e5081__End"/>had mentioned the name of the <lb n="c57-0035__main__6"/>spot for which they were bound and after <lb n="c57-0035__main__7"/>her death the woman of the house in which <lb n="c57-0035__main__8"/>they had lived took care that Safie should <lb n="c57-0035__main__9"/>arrive safely at the cottage of her lover.<lb n="c57-0037__main__1"/>having overcome many difficulties succeeded <lb n="c57-0037__main__2"/>at length in joining her lover in his retreat
